snippet: A meeting convened by Pope Francis will begin a process on whether the Roman Catholic Church will change its approach to issues like divorce, gay civil unions or single parents.
abstract: Leaders of Roman Catholic Church are poised to gather at meeting convened by Pope Francis to discuss whether church should change its approach to several divisive social issues.

byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from New York, Gaia Pianigiani from Vatican City.

lead_paragraph: A meeting convened by Pope Francis will begin a process on whether the Roman Catholic Church will change its approach to issues like divorce, gay civil unions or single parents.

headline.main: Under Francis, Catholic Leaders Prepare to Debate Whether Church Should Change
headline.print_headline: Under Francis, Catholic Leaders Prepare to Debate Whether Church Should Change

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
